intro: Geschollia globuligera, commonly known as the globular geschollia, is a unique member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals that can range in color from white to pink. Geschollia globuligera is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in shaded, moist environments.
